New Records: Rachin Ravindra became NZ's youngest World Cup centurion.
Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra set a new record for the highest partnership for New Zealand in ODI World Cups.
Key Match Events: Mitchell Santner produced a rare 10-over spell of bowling without conceding a boundary.
Matt Henry produced perhaps the ball of the game.
Devon Conway brought up a superb century.
Pre-Game Insights: England were predicted as the favorites given their home advantage.
New Zealand were missing key players due to injuries.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand's unbeaten partnership was a significant morale booster for them.
England will look to bounce back in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under lights due to it being a World Cup game.
England finished with 282 runs for 9 wickets.
Others: The match was played in Ahmedabad, India.
